summary: "The Godfather" is a popular 1972 movie about a powerful crime family, the Corleones, led by Vito Corleone (Marlon Brando). The story follows Vito's youngest son, Michael (Al Pacino), who becomes the new boss after many struggles. It's based on a book by Mario Puzo and was directed by Francis Ford Coppola. The film was a huge success, making lots of money and winning many awards, including Best Picture at the Oscars. It's considered one of the best movies ever made and has two sequels.
title: The Godfather
